snippet.description: * Untitled Document (clueweb12-0000wb-39-18343) http://detroit1701.org/Start1967Riot.html Untitled Document Starting Point of the July, 1967 Racial Riot 9125 Twelfth Street at the corner of Twelfth and Clairmont Early on Sunday morning July 23, 1967; Detroit police raided a "blind pig" at this location expecting to find a few people violating...time before police wagons took them away for booking and then their release. Thus began Detroit's fourth and largest racial riot. As the arrested people were held on 12th street, young men came to the area... [cached version]
